column3: utACK 64854666f57d9f94269000f10897858e8c60d99f. Thanks for introducing\nthe first BOOST_REQUIRE, this was overdue.\n
Why not `BOOST_REQUIRE(ActivateBestChain(state, chainparams));` on one line?
smaller diff and we don't want to imply assertions with side effects are our default coding style :P
Then you should also do the same with the above BOOST_REQUIRE :)
Yeah, it is not consistent, but I don't think it matters too much.
> we don't want to imply assertions with side effects are our default coding style\n\n:thumbsup:

Meh, in the tests it's pretty normal to check something with side effects. This is only an "assertion" in the abstract sense, not the C/C++ sense that it will potentially be disabled (new: tests in release mode, with disabled tests!).\n\nAnyhow let's not nitpick this two-line test change to death.
